service:
The Amazon AppIntegrations service enables you to configure and reuse connections to external applications.

For information about how you can use external applications with Amazon Connect, see Set up pre-built integrations and Deliver information to agents using Amazon Connect Wisdom in the Amazon Connect Administrator Guide.

operations.CreateDataIntegration:
Creates and persists a DataIntegration resource.

You cannot create a DataIntegration association for a DataIntegration that has been previously associated. Use a different DataIntegration, or recreate the DataIntegration using the CreateDataIntegration API.
operations.CreateEventIntegration: Creates an EventIntegration, given a specified name, description, and a reference to an Amazon EventBridge bus in your account and a partner event source that pushes events to that bus. No objects are created in the your account, only metadata that is persisted on the EventIntegration control plane.
operations.DeleteDataIntegration:
Deletes the DataIntegration. Only DataIntegrations that don't have any DataIntegrationAssociations can be deleted. Deleting a DataIntegration also deletes the underlying Amazon AppFlow flow and service linked role.

You cannot create a DataIntegration association for a DataIntegration that has been previously associated. Use a different DataIntegration, or recreate the DataIntegration using the CreateDataIntegration API.
operations.DeleteEventIntegration: Deletes the specified existing event integration. If the event integration is associated with clients, the request is rejected.
operations.GetDataIntegration:
Returns information about the DataIntegration.

You cannot create a DataIntegration association for a DataIntegration that has been previously associated. Use a different DataIntegration, or recreate the DataIntegration using the CreateDataIntegration API.
operations.ListDataIntegrationAssociations:
Returns a paginated list of DataIntegration associations in the account.

You cannot create a DataIntegration association for a DataIntegration that has been previously associated. Use a different DataIntegration, or recreate the DataIntegration using the CreateDataIntegration API.
operations.ListDataIntegrations:
Returns a paginated list of DataIntegrations in the account.

You cannot create a DataIntegration association for a DataIntegration that has been previously associated. Use a different DataIntegration, or recreate the DataIntegration using the CreateDataIntegration API.
operations.ListEventIntegrationAssociations: Returns a paginated list of event integration associations in the account.
operations.ListEventIntegrations: Returns a paginated list of event integrations in the account.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Lists the tags for the specified resource.
operations.TagResource: Adds the specified tags to the specified resource.
operations.UntagResource: Removes the specified tags from the specified resource.
operations.UpdateDataIntegration:
Updates the description of a DataIntegration.

You cannot create a DataIntegration association for a DataIntegration that has been previously associated. Use a different DataIntegration, or recreate the DataIntegration using the CreateDataIntegration API.
operations.UpdateEventIntegration: Updates the description of an event integration.

AccessDeniedException.base: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

refs.CreateEventIntegrationResponse$EventInte: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the event integration.
refs.DataIntegrationAssociationSummary$DataIn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DataIntegration association.
refs.DataIntegrationSummary$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DataIntegration.
refs.EventIntegration$EventIntegrationArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the event integration.
refs.EventIntegrationAssociation$EventIntegra: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the event integration association.
refs.GetDataIntegrationResponse$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the DataIntegration.
refs.GetEventIntegrationResponse$EventIntegra: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the event integration.
refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

refs.DataIntegrationAssociationSummary$Client: The identifier for teh client that is associated with the DataIntegration association.
refs.EventIntegrationAssociation$ClientId: The identifier for the client that is associated with the event integration.

refs.ListDataIntegrationAssociationsResponse$: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) and unique ID of the DataIntegration association.

DuplicateResourceException.base: A resource with the specified name already exists.

refs.EventIntegration$EventBridgeBus: The Amazon EventBridge bus for the event integration.

refs.CreateDataIntegrationResponse$ClientToke: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
refs.CreateEventIntegrationRequest$ClientToke: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

InternalServiceError.base: Request processing failed due to an error or failure with the service.

refs.ListDataIntegrationAssociationsRequest$M: The maximum number of results to return per page.
refs.ListDataIntegrationsRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return per page.
refs.ListEventIntegrationAssociationsRequest$: The maximum number of results to return per page.
refs.ListEventIntegrationsRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return per page.

refs.ListDataIntegrationsResponse$NextToken: If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of results.

refs.ListEventIntegrationAssociationsResponse: If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of results.
refs.ListEventIntegrationsRequest$NextToken: The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of results.
refs.ListEventIntegrationsResponse$NextToken: If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of results.

refs.ScheduleConfiguration$FirstExecutionFrom: The start date for objects to import in the first flow run.

refs.ScheduleConfiguration$Object: The name of the object to pull from the data source.

ResourceQuotaExceededException.base: The allowed quota for the resource has been exceeded.

refs.ScheduleConfiguration$ScheduleExpression: How often the data should be pulled from data source.

ScheduleConfiguration.base: The name of the data and how often it should be pulled from the source.

refs.CreateDataIntegrationRequest$ScheduleCon: The name of the data and how often it should be pulled from the source.
refs.CreateDataIntegrationResponse$ScheduleCo: The name of the data and how often it should be pulled from the source.
refs.GetDataIntegrationResponse$ScheduleConfi: The name of the data and how often it should be pulled from the source.

refs.EventIntegrationAssociation$EventIntegra: The identifier for the event integration association.
